alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Linn; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Thunderstorms producing heavy rain will impact portions of southwestern Buchanan, Johnson, Benton, northern Washington, southwestern Linn and eastern Iowa Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 128 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain producing thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Dysart to near Oxford to near Wayland. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, lightning and additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Locations in the path of these storms include Coralville, Tiffin, North Liberty, University Heights, Hills, Oakdale, Garrison, Iowa City, Lake Macbride State Park, Vinton, Solon, Mount Auburn and Urbana. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 220 and 253. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 28, and between mile markers 39 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
